metadata.case_name: Legal Representatives of Rana Umanath Bakshsingh v. Allahabad Bank Limited

facts.text: Appellant's father Rana Umanath Bakshsingh was the Talukdar of Khajurgaon.
On July 13, 1914, Rana Umanath Bakshsingh executed a simple mortgage in favour of the Allahabad Bank Limited (respondent) for Rs. 6,00,000 mortgaging proprietary rights in sixty-seven villages.
In May 1924, respondent filed suit for recovery of balance unpaid mortgage money by sale of mortgaged property.
In January 1925, preliminary decree passed for Rs. four lacs and odd.
In July 1926, preliminary decree made final directing sale of proprietary rights in sixty-seven villages.
In 1934, U. P. Agriculturists Relief Act passed; judgment-debtor applied for amendment of decree.
On October 19, 1936, decree amended under U. P. Agriculturists Relief Act; pending execution proceedings dropped as installments fixed.
On May 25, 1940, respondent applied for execution; objection on ground of limitation rejected.
Judgment-debtor had sir and khudkashat lands and zamindar's grove in the sixty-seven villages.
On July 1, 1952, U. P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950 (1 of 1951) came into force; zamindari rights of judgment debtor abolished.
Taluka of Khajurgaon was an estate within meaning of the Act and vested in State by notification under s.4.

On September 29, 1952, respondent applied in execution to sell rights in trees and wells in abadi, buildings; bhumidari rights under s.18 in sir, khudkashat, grove land as substituted security; compensation money as substituted security.
Execution court held buildings, trees, wells in abadi liable to sale; entitled to compensation amount as substituted security; bhumidari rights under s.18 liable to sale.

Appellant appealed to Allahabad High Court, Lucknow Bench; urged (i) bhumidari rights under s.18(i) not liable to sale; (ii) application dated September 29, 1952 was fresh execution application barred by time.
High Court repelled contentions, held execution could proceed against bhumidari rights under s.18; 1952 application not fresh but within time; dismissed appeal.
Appellant obtained certificate from High Court to appeal to Supreme Court.

legal_issues.text: Whether bhumidari rights created under s.18 of U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950 can be sold in execution of the mortgage decree.
Whether the application dated September 29, 1952 was a fresh application for execution barred by limitation.

petitioner_arguments.text: Proprietary rights in sixty-seven villages mortgaged vested in State under the Act; respondent entitled only to compensation payable to appellant under s.6(h) of the Act.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950 s.6(h)

petitioner_arguments.text: Bhumidari rights under s.18 are new rights not existing in 1914, hence not covered by mortgage.
Application dated September 29, 1952 is fresh execution application filed over 12 years after amended decree, barred by time.

respondent_arguments.text: Bhumidari rights under s.18 liable to sale as they represented proprietary rights mortgaged or as substituted security.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950 ss.9, 18

respondent_arguments.text: Sir, khudkashat and grove lands continued as property of appellant.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950 ss.9, 18

respondent_arguments.text: Application dated September 29, 1952 not fresh but continuation of earlier execution within time.

court_reasoning.text: Proprietary rights including sir, khudkashat land and grove land vested in State under ss.4 and 6(a)(i); s.9 excepts wells, trees in abadi, buildings which continue to belong to intermediary.
court_reasoning.key_observation: S.18 deems such lands settled with intermediary as bhumidari, creating new right, not continuation of old proprietary right.

court_reasoning.text: Bhumidari rights under s.18 not mortgaged in 1914 as new rights post-vesting.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No compensation for s.18 lands as included in gross assets but excluded from net assets calculation.

court_reasoning.text: S.6(h) provides mortgagee cannot follow vested property but must enforce against interest in estate via s.73 TPA, i.e., compensation money.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Bhumidari rights not compensation; special rights for cultivatory possession.

court_reasoning.text: Since appellant succeeds on first point, no need to consider limitation.

holdings.text: Bhumidari rights created under s.18 of U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act not liable to sale in execution of 1914 mortgage decree; mortgagee relegated to compensation per s.6(h) and s.73 TPA.

statutes_cited.name: U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950 (Act 1 of 1951)
statutes_cited.relevance: Vesting of estates in State; exceptions for certain properties; creation of bhumidari rights; enforcement of pre-vesting mortgages only against compensation.

statutes_cited.name: Transfer of Property Act, 1882
statutes_cited.relevance: Mortgagee entitled to mortgage money from compensation on compulsory acquisition of mortgaged property.

statutes_cited.name: U.P. Zamindars Debt Reduction Act, 1953 (Act XV of 1953)
statutes_cited.relevance: Debts recoverable only from compensation and rehabilitation grant; does not affect construction of Zamindari Act s.6(h).

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; execution of decree by respondent not to be levied against bhumidari rights created under s.18 of the Act in favour of appellant.
outcome.relief_granted: Prohibition on sale of bhumidari rights in execution.
outcome.costs: Appellant awarded costs of Supreme Court and High Court.

key_quotes.text: "the way in which s. 18 is worded... shows that these three kinds of property vested in the State under s. 6(a)(i) and were then resettled with the intermediary on a new tenure and not in the same right, which he had in them before the vesting."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core reasoning that s.18 creates new bhumidari rights post-vesting.

key_quotes.text: "s.6(h) read with s.73 directs that the mortgagee shall proceed in the manner provided in s.73, namely, follow the compensation money, and there is no other way possible for him."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Limits mortgage enforcement to compensation only.
